answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The breathlessness could be due to cardiac or lung disorders. ECHO stress test reflects the cardiac functionality. To assess the lungs, lung function tests are mandatory. Certain systemic disorders like anemia, diabetes, vitamin deficiencies and thyroid disorders can cause these symptoms. Blood tests can help detect this. Please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: recently i experienced chest tightness and shortness of breath. Bowel movements stopped and when I did have one they were very small. Upper and lower GI were normal. Echo stress test was normal. Blood work showed slightly elevated WBC and elevated monocytes. Chest film showed interstitial prominence. CT showed mild emphasema but 2 lymph nodes the largest being 1.5 cm.(hylar and mediastinal) No suspicious pulmonary nodules. My first thought was 10 years of proton pump inhibitors blocking the intrinsic factor affecting B12 absorption.  B12 is the only thing that helps. Antibiotics didnt help. Extreme exertional dyspnea. Any suggestions
